column5: I'm a newbie at fishing but I like to get out when ever I can and I'm starting to use a lot of the tips I've learned on this board.  I was fishing last weekend at a friend's cottage on Gananoque Lake - didn't have much luck. Does anyone have any tips for fishing that lake? I plan on going back in a few weeks. We have a boat - which helps.  Any help is appreciated!  Thanks
Drop offs, underwater structure, different bait, different techniques... slow down!  Evening time, get a top water and fish around lily pads, twitchng and pausing the bait.  Don't yank to fast.
Thanks for the tips.  Is this considered a top water bait (Challenger Minnow)? It usually sits about 12" below the water when I'm realing it in. (see pic)
could be when at rest. but its more of a diver.
Good luck, and remember fishing is supposed to be fun, don't get frustrated
